items.q: Julius Caesar was the first Emperor of Rome.
items.explanation: Augustus (Octavian) was the first Roman Emperor. Caesar was a dictator.

items.q: What ancient civilization built the pyramids at Giza?
items.explanation: They were built as tombs for the pharaohs.

items.q: Which country gifted the Statue of Liberty to the USA?
items.explanation: It was dedicated in 1886 to commemorate the alliance between France and the US.

items.q: Who was the Queen of England during the Spanish Armada's defeat in 1588?
items.explanation: Her reign is known as the Elizabethan era.

items.q: What year did World War II end?
items.explanation: The war ended with the surrender of Germany in May and Japan in September.

items.q: What famous wall in Germany was torn down in 1989?
items.explanation: Its fall marked the beginning of the reunification of Germany.

items.q: Who was the civil rights leader who gave the 'I Have a Dream' speech?
items.explanation: He delivered the speech during the March on Washington in 1963.

items.q: What was the name of the ship that brought the Pilgrims to America in 1620?
items.explanation: They established the Plymouth Colony in Massachusetts.
